abstract.text: A view that displays data from a HealthKit activity summary object.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The
view displays data from an
object, using the Move, Exercise, and Stand activity rings (see
The activity ring view always appears as a black rectangle with red, green, and blue concentric rings. The rings are centered in the view, and sized to fit the available space (see

The rings have two different ways to display a lack of data. One indicates that the activity summary is missing, and the other indicates that the activity summary’s values are set to zero. If the ring has a
-valued
property, the rings appear empty (see See
). Use this to indicate that there is no summary data available for the specified day (for example, dates in the future).
If the summary has zero-valued quantities set for its value properties,  the ring displays a dot at the top of the ring (see
). Use this to indicate that the user has not yet burned any active calories, exercised, or earned any stand hours for the specified day.
To display activity summary data from the HealthKit store, use an
object. You can also instantiate and display your own
objects, as needed.
To display data for a ring, the
object must have a non-
quantity for both the corresponding value property and goal property (see the following table).
Ring
Value property
Goal property
Move
Exercise
Stand
The activity ring view colors a percentage of each ring based on these properties, as shown here:

code: ring percent = value property quantity / goal property quantity

abstract.text: An object that contains the move, exercise, and stand data for a given day.
A query for reading activity summary objects from the HealthKit store.
The user’s daily goal for stand hours.
The amount of time that the user has spent exercising during the specified day.
The user’s daily goal for active energy burned.
The user’s daily exercise goal.
The number hours in the specified day during which the user has stood and moved for at least a minute per hour.
The amount of active energy the user burned during the specified day.
Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A view that displays data from a HealthKit activity summary object.
Creates an activity ring view for use in SwiftUI.
Sets the activity summary displayed by the activity ring view.
A button that you can use to trigger a Sign in with Apple request.
A button in the user interface of your watchOS app.
A label that displays the current date or time.
An interface element that displays static text.
An interface element that displays a noninteractive map for the location you specify.
An object that provides information that is common to all interface objects in your watchOS app.
A button that you can use to trigger payments through Apple Pay.
An interface element that lets users select a single floating-point value from a range of values.
An interface element that toggles between an On and Off state.
An interface element that displays an editable text area.
A label that displays a countdown or count-up timer.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
